intro: Anemone scabiosa, commonly known as the "scented bellflower," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually basal, with a slightly hairy texture, and its stems are upright and often branched. Anemone scabiosa is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
